50 LoggerBuffer::LoggerBuffer(std::size_t bufferSize)
51  : m_buffer(bufferSize + 1), m_context(""), m_padding(""),
52  m_consoleEnabled(false), m_consoleTimestampEnabled(false), m_console(&std::cout), m_consolePrefix(""),
53  m_fileEnabled(false), m_fileTimestampEnabled(true), m_file(nullptr), m_filePrefix("")
54 {
55  // Set the buffer
56  char *bufferBegin = &m_buffer.front();
57  setp(bufferBegin, bufferBegin + m_buffer.size() - 1);
58 
59  // Set console data
60  setConsoleEnabled(true);
61 
62  // Set log file data
63  setFileEnabled(false);
64 }
65 
69 LoggerBuffer::~LoggerBuffer()
70 {
71  sync();
72 }
73 
85 LoggerBuffer::int_type LoggerBuffer::overflow(int_type character)
86 {
87  if (character != traits_type::eof()) {
88  // Write the charater to the buffer and then increment pptr() by
89  // calling pbump(1). It's always safe to write thecharater to the
90  // buffer because we reserved an extra char at the end of our buffer
91  // in the constructor.
92  assert(std::less_equal<char *>()(pptr(), epptr()));
93  *pptr() = character;
94  pbump(1);
95 
96  // Flush the stream
97  if (sync() == 0) {
98  return character;
99  }
100  }
101 
102  return traits_type::eof();
103 }
104 
110 int LoggerBuffer::sync()
111 {
112  return flush(false);
113 }
114 
122 int LoggerBuffer::flush(bool terminate)
123 {
124  int status = 0;
125  if (pptr() == pbase()) {
126  return status;
127  }
128 
129  // Identify line breakers
130  std::vector<char *> linePointers;
131  linePointers.push_back(pbase());
132  for (char *p = pbase(), *e = pptr() - 1; p != e; ++p) {
133  if (*p == '\n') {
134  linePointers.push_back(p + 1);
135  }
136  }
137  linePointers.push_back(pptr());
138 
139  // Detect if a new line must be added at the end
140  terminate = (terminate && *(linePointers.back() - 1) != '\n');
141 
142  // Move the internal pointer
143  std::ptrdiff_t nCharacters = pptr() - pbase();
144  pbump(- nCharacters);
145 
146  // Write all lines
147  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < linePointers.size() - 1; ++i) {
148  char *firstCharacter = linePointers[i];
149  char *lastCharacter = linePointers[i + 1];
150  std::ptrdiff_t lineSize = lastCharacter - firstCharacter;
151 
152  // Write to the console
153  if (m_console && m_consoleEnabled) {
154  if (m_consoleTimestampEnabled) {
155  *m_console << "[" + getTimestamp() + "] ";
156  }
157 
158  if (!m_consolePrefix.empty()) {
159  *m_console << m_consolePrefix << " :: ";
160  }
161 
162  if (!m_context.empty()) {
163  *m_console << m_context << " :: ";
164  }
165 
166  if (!m_padding.empty()) {
167  *m_console << m_padding;
168  }
169 
170  m_console->write(firstCharacter, lineSize);
171  if ((m_console->rdstate() & std::ifstream::failbit ) != 0) {
172  status = -1;
173  }
174 
175  if (terminate && lastCharacter == linePointers.back()) {
176  *m_console << "\n";
177  }
178  }
179 
180  // Write to file
181  if (m_file && m_fileEnabled && m_file->is_open()) {
182  if (m_fileTimestampEnabled) {
183  *m_file << "[" + getTimestamp() + "] ";
184  }
185 
186  if (!m_filePrefix.empty()) {
187  *m_file << m_filePrefix << " :: ";
188  }
189 
190  if (!m_context.empty()) {
191  *m_file << m_context + " :: ";
192  }
193 
194  if (!m_padding.empty()) {
195  *m_file << m_padding;
196  }
197 
198  m_file->write(firstCharacter, lineSize);
199  if ((m_file->rdstate() & std::ifstream::failbit ) != 0) {
200  status = -1;
201  }
202 
203  if (terminate && lastCharacter == linePointers.back()) {
204  *m_file << "\n";
205  }
206  }
207  }
208 
209  return status;
210 }

399 const std::string LoggerBuffer::getTimestamp() const
400 {
401  auto currentClock = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
402  std::time_t currentTime = std::chrono::system_clock::to_time_t(currentClock);
403 
404  auto seconds = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::seconds>(currentClock.time_since_epoch());
405  auto millisecs = std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>(currentClock.time_since_epoch() - seconds);
406  std::ostringstream millisecsConverter;
407  millisecsConverter << (millisecs.count());
408 
409  char buffer[80];
410  strftime(buffer, 80, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S", localtime(&currentTime));
411  std::string timestamp(buffer);
412  timestamp += "." + millisecsConverter.str();
413 
414  return timestamp;
415 }
416 
432 Logger::Logger(const std::string &name,
433  std::ostream *consoleStream, std::ofstream *fileStream,
434  int nProcessors, int rank)
435  : std::ios(0), std::ostream(&m_buffer),
436  m_name(name), m_nProcessors(nProcessors), m_rank(rank), m_buffer(256),
437  m_indentation(0), m_context(""), m_priority(log::NORMAL), m_visibility(log::MASTER),
438  m_consoleVerbosity(log::NORMAL), m_fileVerbosity(log::NORMAL)
439 {
440  // Set buffer data
441  setConsoleStream(consoleStream);
442  setFileStream(fileStream);
443 
444  // Set parallel data
445  if (m_nProcessors > 1) {
446  int nDigits = ceil(log10(m_nProcessors));
447  std::ostringstream convert;
448  convert << std::setw(nDigits) << m_rank;
449  std::string rankPrefix = "#" + convert.str();
450 
451  m_buffer.setConsolePrefix(rankPrefix);
452  m_buffer.setFilePrefix(rankPrefix);
453  } else {
454  m_buffer.setConsolePrefix("");
455  m_buffer.setFilePrefix("");
456  }
457 
458  // Reset verbosity
459  setConsoleVerbosity(m_consoleVerbosity);
460  setFileVerbosity(m_fileVerbosity);
461 
462  // Set logger data
463  setPriority(log::NORMAL);
464  setVisibility(log::MASTER);
465 }
466

598 
604 void Logger::setConsoleVerbosity(log::Verbosity verbosity)
605 {
606  m_consoleVerbosity = verbosity;
607  if (m_consoleVerbosity == log::QUIET) {
608  m_buffer.setConsoleEnabled(false);
609  } else if (m_visibility == log::MASTER && (m_rank != 0)) {
610  m_buffer.setConsoleEnabled(false);
611  } else {
612  m_buffer.setConsoleEnabled(m_consoleVerbosity >= m_priority);
613  }
614 }
615

623  return m_consoleVerbosity;

656 
662 void Logger::setFileVerbosity(log::Verbosity verbosity)
663 {
664  m_fileVerbosity = verbosity;
665 
666  bool isFileEnabled;
667  if (m_fileVerbosity == log::QUIET) {
668  isFileEnabled = false;
669  } else if (m_visibility == log::MASTER && (m_rank != 0)) {
670  isFileEnabled = false;
671  } else {
672  isFileEnabled = (m_fileVerbosity >= m_priority);
673  }
674  m_buffer.setFileEnabled(isFileEnabled);
675 }

724 void Logger::setIndentation(int delta)
725 {
726  m_indentation = std::max(m_indentation + delta, 0);

821 void Logger::print(const std::string &message)
822 {
823  (*this) << message;
824 }

832 void Logger::print(const std::string &message, log::Priority priority)
833 {
834  print(message, priority, getVisibility());
835 }
836 
843 void Logger::print(const std::string &message, log::Visibility visibility)
844 {
845  print(message, getPriority(), visibility);
846 }
847 
855 void Logger::print(const std::string &message, log::Priority priority, log::Visibility visibility)
856 {
857  log::Priority initialPriority = getPriority();
858  if (priority != initialPriority) {
859  setPriority(priority);
860  }
861 
862  log::Visibility initialVisibility = getVisibility();
863  if (visibility != initialVisibility) {
864  setVisibility(visibility);
865  }
866 
867  (*this) << message;
868 
869  if (priority != initialPriority) {
870  setPriority(initialPriority);
871  }
872 
873  if (visibility != initialVisibility) {
874  setVisibility(initialVisibility);
875  }
876 }

888  Initialize logger manager instance.

894 */

898  Default directory for the logger.
899 */
900 std::string LoggerManager::BITPIT_LOG_DIRECTORY = ".";

905 LoggerManager::LoggerManager()
906  : m_defaultName(BITPIT_LOG_NAME), m_defaultDirectory(BITPIT_LOG_DIRECTORY),
907  m_mode(log::SEPARATE)
908 {
909 
910 }
911 
915 LoggerManager::~LoggerManager()
916 {
917  // Get a list of the loggers
918  std::vector<std::string> loggerNames;
919  loggerNames.reserve(m_loggers.size());
920  for (const auto &entry : m_loggers) {
921  loggerNames.push_back(entry.first);
922  }
923 
924  // Destry all the loggers
925  for (const std::string &name : loggerNames) {
926  destroy(name, true);
927  }
928 }
929 
935 LoggerManager & LoggerManager::manager()
936 {
937  if (!m_manager) {
938  m_manager = std::unique_ptr<LoggerManager>(new LoggerManager());
939  }
940 
941  return *m_manager;
942 }

949 Logger & LoggerManager::cout()
950 {
951  return cout(m_defaultName);
952 }
953 
963 Logger & LoggerManager::cout(const std::string &name)
964 {
965  // The logger has to be created
966  if (m_loggers.count(name) == 0) {
967  if (!isInitialized()) {
968  setMode(log::SEPARATE);
969  }
970 
971  if (name == m_defaultName) {
972  _create(name, false, m_defaultDirectory, 1, 0);
973  } else {
974  create(name, false, m_defaultDirectory, 1, 0);
975  }
976  }
977 
978  // Return the logger
979  return *(m_loggers.at(name));
980 }
981 
990 void LoggerManager::initialize(log::Mode mode, bool reset,
991  int nProcessors, int rank)
992 {
993  initialize(mode, m_defaultName, reset, m_defaultDirectory, nProcessors, rank);
994 }
995 
1005 void LoggerManager::initialize(log::Mode mode, bool reset, const std::string &directory,
1006  int nProcessors, int rank)
1007 {
1008  initialize(mode, m_defaultName, reset, directory, nProcessors, rank);
1009 }
1010 
1021 void LoggerManager::initialize(log::Mode mode, const std::string &name, bool reset,
1022  const std::string &directory,
1023  int nProcessors, int rank)
1024 {
1025  if (isInitialized()) {
1026  log::cout().println("Logger initialization has to be called before creating the loggers.");
1027  return;
1028  }
1029 
1030  // Set mode
1031  setMode(mode);
1032 
1033  // Set the dafault data
1034  m_defaultName = name;
1035  m_defaultDirectory = directory;
1036 
1037  // Create the logger
1038  _create(m_defaultName, reset, directory, nProcessors, rank);
1039 }
1040 
1049 void LoggerManager::create(const std::string &name, bool reset,
1050  int nProcessors, int rank)
1051 {
1052  create(name, reset, m_defaultDirectory, nProcessors, rank);
1053 }
1054 
1064 void LoggerManager::create(const std::string &name, bool reset,
1065  const std::string &directory,
1066  int nProcessors, int rank)
1067 {
1068  // Its not possible to create a log with the default name nor a log
1069  // with the same name of an existent logger nor a log with an empty
1070  // name
1071  if (exists(name)) {
1072  m_loggerUsers[name]++;
1073 
1074  cout(name) << "Detected an attemp to create the logger \"" << name << "\" twice" << std::endl;
1075  cout(name) << "The previously created logger will be used." << std::endl;
1076  return;
1077  } else if (name == m_defaultName) {
1078  cout(m_defaultName) << "Detected an attemp to overwrite the default logger" << std::endl;
1079  cout(m_defaultName) << "The name of the default logger is \"" << name << "\"" << std::endl;
1080  return;
1081  } else if (name == "") {
1082  cout() << "Detected an attemp to create a logger with an empty name" << std::endl;
1083  return;
1084  }
1085 
1086  // Create the logger
1087  if (m_mode == log::SEPARATE) {
1088  _create(name, reset, directory, nProcessors, rank);
1089  } else {
1090  _create(name, cout(m_defaultName));
1091  }
1092 }
1093 
1105 bool LoggerManager::destroy(const std::string &name, bool force)
1106 {
1107  if (!exists(name)) {
1108  return false;
1109  }
1110 
1111  // Decrement the users
1112  int &nUsers = m_loggerUsers[name];
1113  nUsers--;
1114 
1115  // If the logger has no users we can delete it
1116  if (nUsers == 0 || force) {
1117  // Remove the logger from the manager
1118  m_loggers.erase(name);
1119  m_loggerUsers.erase(name);
1120 
1121  // If the logger has it own file stream, delete it
1122  if (m_fileStreams.count(name) > 0) {
1123  // Close the stream
1124  std::ofstream &fileStream = *(m_fileStreams.at(name));
1125  fileStream.close();
1126 
1127  // Remove the stream
1128  m_fileStreams.erase(name);
1129  }
1130 
1131  return true;
1132  } else {
1133  return false;
1134  }
1135 }
1136 
1143 bool LoggerManager::exists(const std::string &name) const
1144 {
1145  return (m_loggers.count(name) != 0);
1146 }
1147 
1158 bool LoggerManager::isInitialized() const
1159 {
1160  return (m_loggers.size() > 0);
1161 }
1162 
1171 bool LoggerManager::setMode(log::Mode mode)
1172 {
1173  if (isInitialized()) {
1174  cout().println("The policy has to be set before creating the loggers.");
1175  return false;
1176  }
1177 
1178  m_mode = mode;
1179  return true;
1180 }
1181 
1187 log::Mode LoggerManager::getMode() const
1188 {
1189  return m_mode;
1190 }
1191 
1201 void LoggerManager::_create(const std::string &name, bool reset,
1202  const std::string &directory,
1203  int nProcessors, int rank)
1204 {
1205  // Get the file path
1206  FileHandler fileHandler;
1207  fileHandler.setDirectory(directory);
1208  fileHandler.setName(name);
1209  fileHandler.setAppendix("log");
1210  fileHandler.setParallel(nProcessors > 1);
1211  if (nProcessors > 1) {
1212  fileHandler.setBlock(rank);
1213  }
1214 
1215  std::string filePath = fileHandler.getPath();
1216 
1217  // Create the file stream
1218  std::ios_base::openmode fileMode;
1219  if (reset) {
1220  fileMode = std::ofstream::out;
1221  } else {
1222  fileMode = std::ofstream::app;
1223  }
1224 
1225  m_fileStreams[name] = std::unique_ptr<std::ofstream>(new std::ofstream());
1226  std::ofstream &fileStream = *(m_fileStreams.at(name));
1227  fileStream.rdbuf()->pubsetbuf(0, 0);
1228  fileStream.open(filePath, fileMode);
1229 
1230  // Use cout as console stream
1231  std::ostream &consoleStream = std::cout;
1232 
1233  // Create the logger
1234  m_loggers[name] = std::unique_ptr<Logger>(new Logger(name, &consoleStream, &fileStream, nProcessors, rank));
1235  m_loggerUsers[name] = 1;
1236 }
1237 
1245 void LoggerManager::_create(const std::string &name, Logger &master)
1246 {
1247  std::ostream &consoleStream = master.getConsoleStream();
1248  std::ofstream &fileStream = master.getFileStream();
1249 
1250  int rank = master.getRank();
1251  int nProcessors = master.getProcessorCount();
1252 
1253  m_loggers[name] = std::unique_ptr<Logger>(new Logger(name, &consoleStream, &fileStream, nProcessors, rank));
1254  m_loggerUsers[name] = 1;
1255 
1256  // Import logger settings
1257  Logger &logger = *(m_loggers.at(name));
1258  logger.setConsoleTimestampEnabled(master.isConsoleTimestampEnabled());
1259  logger.setConsoleVerbosity(master.getConsoleVerbosity());
1260  logger.setFileTimestampEnabled(master.isFileTimestampEnabled());
1261  logger.setFileVerbosity(master.getFileVerbosity());
1262  logger.setVisibility(master.getVisibility());
1263  logger.setPriority(master.getPriority());
1264 }
